meanings.definition: In a manner expressing contempt or disapproval
meanings.sent1: She looked at him snidely when he made a rude comment.
meanings.sent2: He spoke snidely about her outfit, making her feel bad.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed snidely at the dog, annoyed by its barking.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds moved snidely across the sky, foretelling a storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher glared snidely at the students misbehaving in class.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a sneering or mocking attitude
meanings.sent1: Her snidely remarks hurt his feelings.
meanings.sent2: The snidely laughter of the bullies echoed in the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The snidely jester entertained the crowd with his sharp wit.
meanings.sent4: The snidely grin on his face revealed his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The snidely tone in her voice made it clear she was not impressed.
